periore congre&longs;&longs;u fusè &longs;atis tradidimus, vt patet; &longs;ed cùm prædictum &longs;e­
gmentum ab aëris Cylindro non &longs;u&longs;tineatur, vt &longs;upra o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t, æ&longs;tus
maris ad rem hanc nihil facit: vbi autem hæc inaudij, probavi rem accura­
ti&longs;&longs;imè, &longs;ervata fi&longs;tula in &longs;itu perpendiculari BD eum &longs;egmento extantis
Mercurij CI, per totos ferè 30. dies, ob&longs;ervavi multam mutationem altitu­
dinis; nam Mercurius aliquando &longs;upra C a&longs;&longs;urgere, aliquando infra &longs;ub&longs;idere
mihi, alii&longs;que, quibus o&longs;tendi, &longs;æpè ac &longs;æpiùs vi&longs;us e&longs;t, nunquam tamen
æ&longs;tus maris leges &longs;ervavit, &longs;ive diurnas, ita vt momento &longs;ummi æ&longs;tus, quo
Luna e&longs;t in Meridiano, &longs;ub&longs;ideret, & momento &longs;ummi rece&longs;&longs;us, &longs;eu reflu­
xus, Luna &longs;cilicet Meridianum &longs;extæ horæ occupante, a&longs;&longs;urgeret; &longs;ive leges
men&longs;truas, ita vt in Plenilunio & Novilunio &longs;ub&longs;ideret, in Quadraturis a&longs;­
&longs;urgeret: Idem Florentiæ & Liburni ob&longs;ervatum fuit, vt à viro &longs;umma fi­
de digno accepi; quare non e&longs;t, quod multùm curemus de prædicta illa ob­
&longs;ervatione, quæ cum certis experimentis minimè con&longs;entit; quare, ne tem­
pus teramus, profer quæ&longs;o, &longs;i quid fortè re&longs;tat.
Augu&longs;tin.

Ve&longs;tri Pari&longs;ien&longs;es aliquid jactant, quod tibi fortè nonnihil
negotij face&longs;&longs;at; Sit enim vas ABD, in quod in­
fundatur Mercurius, &longs;it fi&longs;tula CP, cum ampulla IP,
aperta in P, latiore foramine, & aliud vas HKNL
ampullæ in&longs;it, recto &longs;itu, vt vides; in&longs;eratur fi&longs;tula
OI, admotoque pre&longs;sè digito in C, infundatur
per O Mercurius, donec tum vas HN, tum fi&longs;tu­
la CP, tum ampulla, tum fi&longs;tula IO impleantur;
tum &longs;uilla ve&longs;ica probè ob&longs;truantur, debito &longs;ci­
licet tempore, foramina P & O, itemque perexi­
guus canaliculus R ; his demum omnibus peractis,
&longs;ubducatur digitus ex C, Mercurius ruit deor&longs;um
ex vtraque fi&longs;tula, ita vt totum extans &longs;egmen­
tum NO vacuum Mercurio maneat, extetque &longs;e­
gmentum FT Mercurio plenum, altum ferè pe­
des duos & . Si autem vel minima acicula in ve­
&longs;ica R foramen aperias, & tantulum aëris &longs;ub­
eat, &longs;ub&longs;idit illico Mercurius infra T, in fi&longs;tula
CP, a&longs;&longs;urgitque &longs;upra in fi&longs;tula IO, quia &longs;cilicet,
inquiunt, aër qui &longs;ubiit, premit &longs;uperficiem Mer­
curij TV, & LN, vnde vtramque deprimi ne­
ce&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t, &longs;ed LN deprimi non pote&longs;t, ni&longs;i Mercurius &longs;upra LN, in fi&longs;tula
IO a&longs;cendat.

Antim. Hæc dicunt, &longs;at &longs;cio; &longs;ed quis amabo &longs;ibi per&longs;uadeat, tantulum
aëris qui &longs;ubit, adeò compre&longs;&longs;um manere, vt vtramque illam Mercurij &longs;u­
perficiem deprimat; in no&longs;tra hypothe&longs;i longè faciliùs res i&longs;ta explicatur;
nempe cùm po&longs;t Mercurij de&longs;cen&longs;um, tum in PV, tum in NO, illa materia
ten&longs;a remaneat, accedente illa aëris particula, quæ &longs;tatim dilatatur, illa ma­
teria &longs;e&longs;e aliqua ex parte reducit in &longs;egmento NO. cùm minor vis alterius
materiæ ten&longs;æ re&longs;i&longs;tat, vnde hæc vincitur, & adducitur mediante Mercurio
contento in va&longs;e HN, item Mercurius GT tantulùm &longs;ub&longs;idit; quid quæ&longs;o
faciliùs excogitari pote&longs;t?

Ex quo vides, opinor, hoc experimento no&longs;tram
hypothe&longs;im non parum confirmari.

Idem accidit, vt &longs;upra dictum e&longs;t, &longs;i in reci­
piente, ex quo deinde aër exugitur, fi&longs;tula illa po&longs;t de&longs;cen&longs;um Mercurij in­
cludatur; nempe exhau&longs;to aëre, vt &longs;ũmpta dictum e&longs;t, tenditur aër in reci­
piente contentus, hic vero &longs;uperficiem Mercurij va&longs;e contenti attollit, ex
quo nece&longs;&longs;ariò &longs;equitur, vtin fi&longs;tula &longs;ub&longs;idat; hinc vides cuncta hæc in no&longs;tra
hypothe&longs;i facilè &longs;olvi, quæ à nonnullis alioquin in&longs;olubilia e&longs;&longs;e credebantur.
Augu&longs;tin.

quia &longs;ubtilis illa materia ad volatum inepta e&longs;t,
cùm præ tenuitate facilè per meatus pennarum eat.

Secundò, Ani­
malcula ibidem moriuntur, quia materia illa ten&longs;a inepta e&longs;t ad
re&longs;pirandum; immò aliquando accidit, vt animalculum ibidem in­
clu&longs;um valde intumuerit; in ve&longs;ica, de qua &longs;upra, perfectam habe-
mus analogiam; hæc aliaque &longs;imilia facilè intelliguntur, explicanturque;
aliqua tamen &longs;unt ab Autore &longs;upra laudato commemorata, quæ plus ne­
gotij fortè face&longs;&longs;erent; quam ob rem etiam atque etiam te rogo, vt ad tua
principia illa reducas.
Illa obiter &longs;uggero.
Antim.

Su&longs;tine, quæ&longs;o; neque enim hoc pro dignitate fieri pote&longs;t, ni&longs;i res
in longum, atque adeò hic congre&longs;&longs;us longiùs producatur, quàm par &longs;it; mo­
dò &longs;ufficiat, vel obiter indica&longs;&longs;e, exhau&longs;to aëre ex dicto recipiente, illos om­
nes effectus ten&longs;æ materiæ facilè tribui po&longs;&longs;e, quos præfatus Autor aëri in
libertatem vindicato attribuit; nempe quoad effectum perinde e&longs;t, &longs;ive pel­
las ab intrin&longs;eco, &longs;ive ab extrin&longs;eco eadem vi adducas & trahas; hinc ex va­
riis liquoribus bullæ a&longs;cendunt, quas &longs;cilicet &longs;ubtilis illa materia ten&longs;a oc­
cupat; hinc præ nimia bullarum copia, liquor ante Diaphanus albe&longs;cit, tu­
met, exundat, ebullit, etiam aqua pura, præ&longs;ertim calida; nempe illa vi, qua
&longs;uperficies liquoris &longs;ur&longs;um attollitur, di&longs;trahuntur tantulùm partes, ac proin­
de partes &longs;ubtilis materiæ interpo&longs;itæ liberiores &longs;unt, vt &longs;ur&longs;um bullatim
adducantur, idque vario eventu, pro diver&longs;o liquoris genere, &longs;inguli exa­
minandi e&longs;&longs;ent, &longs;ed ne &longs;altemus extra chorum res in aliud tempus di&longs;cutien­
da remittitur.

Duo tantùm hîc breviter adnoto, quæ ad præ&longs;entem contro­
ver&longs;iam pertinent; Primum e&longs;t, &longs;i fi&longs;tula quæ ad de&longs;cen&longs;um Mercurij adhi­
beri &longs;olet, ampullam habeat HP, intra quam alia
minor ampulla per foramen P immutatur, altio­
re collo, &longs;eu tubo PO in&longs;tructa, eoque aperto in
O, po&longs;tquam autem probè alligatum fuerit collum
PO, ita vt per foramen P nihil pror&longs;us aëris in
ampullam HP &longs;ubire valeat, &longs;i per o&longs;tium C in­
fundatur Mercurius, ac deinde, vbi plena fuerit fi­
&longs;tula CP admoto digito, immer&longs;oque extremo C
in Mercurium, digitus &longs;ubducatur, ruit, more &longs;olito,
Mercurius; &longs;ed mirum dictu, bulla minor immi&longs;&longs;a
in majorem HP in de&longs;cen&longs;u Mercurij frangitur.

Augu&longs;t. Hæc vna e&longs;t, meo &longs;altem judicio, ex præ­
cipuis difficultatibus, quæ &longs;i occurri&longs;&longs;et, illam haud
dubiè non omi&longs;i&longs;&longs;em; nempe facilè dicent, maxi­
mam vim aëris incumbentis in cavum bullæ, quam
non defendit aër, convexum ambiens, cùm vel va­
cuum &longs;it, vel materia ten&longs;a in&longs;it, dicent, inquam, ma­
ximam illam vim prædictæ fractionis cau&longs;am e&longs;&longs;e.
Antim.

Sed dic mihi, &longs;odes, cur eadem vis aëris
incumbentis in convexum bullæ HP, &longs;emota mi­
nore, illam etiam non frangit?
Augu&longs;tin.

Inde certè tua &longs;ententia non confirmatur; nempè &longs;ive dicas
minorem bullam frangi vi materiæ ten&longs;æ, &longs;ive vt alij volunt, vi aëris in­
cumbentis, æquè vtrimque &longs;unt angu&longs;tiæ; &longs;ic enim jure pati in&longs;to, &longs;i vis ma­
teriæ ten&longs;æ adducens convexum minoris bullæ illam frangit, cur majorem
non frangit, cùm æquè illius concavum adducat?
Antim.

Addo vnum, quod difficultatem auget, nempe &longs;i tota res fiat
clau&longs;o tubo in O, minor bulla non rumpitur.
Augu&longs;tin.

Rectè dixi&longs;ti augeri difficultatem; cùm inde facilè deducam,
ampullam non frangi à materia ten&longs;a contenta in majore ampulla HP,
quia reverà etiam clau&longs;o O&longs;tio O, eadem e&longs;t applicata convexo minoris
bullæ, illam tamen non frangit; &longs;ed aperto foramine O, &longs;tatim frangitur;
igitur ab alia cau&longs;a, eaque applicata; nulla autem alia excogitari pote&longs;t, à vi
exterioris aëris incubantis di&longs;tincta.
Antim.

Ab vtraque certè cau&longs;a hunc fractionis effectum e&longs;&longs;e nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t;
cùm vtraque applicata &longs;it, altera convexo, altera concavo; gravitat autem
aër exterior in cavum bullæ, quia illa materia ten&longs;a, quæ convexum ambit, e&longs;t
levior aëre, jam verò in hoc, &longs;upra laudato Autori a&longs;&longs;entior, quod ideo minor
bulla frangatur, non verò major ; quia hujus &longs;uperficies versùs centrum
pellitur, & cùm &longs;it ad in&longs;tar cuju&longs;dam fornicis, quid mirum, &longs;i magis re&longs;i&longs;tat,
quàm minor, cujus &longs;uperficies a centro di&longs;trahitur.

Vnde futurum, conclu­
do, &longs;i hæc figura bullarum mutetur, ita vt cavum majoris, & convexum
minoris aëri externo &longs;it expo&longs;itum, &longs;ecus atque ante accidet; tunc enim
major bulla frangetur, minor verò indemnis manebit.
Augu&longs;tin.

Scire ex te velim, vtrùm hoc experimento vnquam probatis,
an verò intellexeris ab aliis fui&longs;&longs;e probata.
Antim.

In hoc genere, à quopiam probata fui&longs;&longs;e ne&longs;cio, nece&longs;&longs;aria tantùm
con&longs;ecutione deduco; in alio tamen genere legi apud Autorem &longs;upra lau­
datum, aliquid &longs;imile; quòd &longs;cilicet bulla in recipiente collocata exhau&longs;to
aëre tantulùm explicetur; vt colligitur ex eo quod cùm ante aqua &longs;emiplena
e&longs;&longs;et, & in canaliculo immer&longs;o & ad collum ejus pre&longs;sè alligato aliquantu­
lum a&longs;&longs;urgeret, exhau&longs;to deinde aëre ex dicto recipiente aqua in canaliculo
tantulùm &longs;ub&longs;idere vi&longs;a &longs;it, quod certè vni duntaxat vitri, &longs;eu bullæ explicatio­
ni tribui pote&longs;t: alterum &longs;imile pa&longs;&longs;im occurrit; &longs;i enim ampullam tenui & lon­
giore collo in&longs;tructam, & aqua ferè plenam nive obruas, aqua illico per collum
tantulùm a&longs;&longs;urgit, non aliam certè ob causam, ni&longs;i propter contractionem ampul­
læ; &longs;i autem concavum &longs;it exteriùs, & convexum interius, &longs;ecus omnino accidit.
Augu&longs;tin. Hæc ad primum tantummodò &longs;pectant de altero verò quid
Antim.

Sit vas A con&longs;tructum iuxta formam
de&longs;criptam in Figura infundatur aqua, cu­
jus &longs;uprema &longs;uperficies &longs;it KI. a&longs;&longs;urgit per ca­
naliculum GDF v&longs;que ad E, includatur autem
in recipiente, quod deinde probè ob&longs;truatur, exu­
cto aëre ex dicto recipiente, non &longs;ub&longs;idit aqua in
canaliculo infra E, ce&longs;&longs;at tamen compre&longs;&longs;io aëris
incubantis vtrique &longs;uperficiei KI, & E; illa igi­
tur compre&longs;&longs;io cau&longs;a non e&longs;t hujus elevationis aquæ, per canaliculum GF.
Augu&longs;tin.

Præclarum certè experimentum, quod tuam illam hypothe­
&longs;im, &longs;altem, vt mihi videtur, penitus de&longs;truit.
Antim.

Primo a&longs;pectu, qua&longs;i nodus indi&longs;&longs;olubilis e&longs;&longs;e videtur; non tamen
vrget; nempe cùm &longs;ugatur canaliculus à materia ten&longs;a per &longs;uperius orificium,
& cùm materia æquè ten&longs;a e&longs;&longs;e &longs;upponatur in toto recipientis &longs;patio, ne-
que hinc, neque illinc adduci pote&longs;t; quod enim vincitur debilius e&longs;t.
Augu&longs;tin.

Non &longs;olvis nodum; nempe à materia ten&longs;a æquè attollitur &longs;u­
perficies KI ac &longs;uperficies E; vnde &longs;i habeatur tantùm ratio vis ten&longs;ionis,
fateor vltro aquam in va&longs;e non po&longs;&longs;e a&longs;&longs;urgere, nec &longs;ub&longs;idere in canalicu­
lo; at &longs;i accedat gravitas &longs;egmenti aquæ extantis in canaliculo, qua corpus
grave deor&longs;um fertur, haud dubiè illa pars prævalet, cui &longs;ocia, vel auxiliaris
gravitas accedit; nimirum illa, quæ &longs;uperficiem KI &longs;ur&longs;um adducit, ac proin­
de &longs;uperficiem E deor&longs;um.

Antim. Eò tandem hujus argumenti vis poterat promoveri; hoc tamen
non ob&longs;tante, ex eo &longs;altem omnis difficultas ce&longs;&longs;are videtur; quod aqua &longs;ub­
&longs;idere non po&longs;&longs;it, ni&longs;i aër quoque &longs;ub&longs;idat; ægrè autem &longs;ub&longs;idere pote&longs;t, tum
propter ten&longs;ionem, tum propter canaliculi angu&longs;tias; accedit quod nullo
adhuc certo experimento con&longs;tat aquam exhau&longs;to aëre in canaliculo tan­
tulum non &longs;ub&longs;idere, vt &longs;upra laudatus Autor vltro fatetur.

Prætereà modi­
cæ & fortè in&longs;en&longs;ibiles bullæ, quæ vi ten&longs;ionis, ex aqua in canaliculo con­
tenta a&longs;&longs;urgunt, facilè impediunt, ne aqua &longs;ub&longs;idat, propter adhæ&longs;ionem
quandam partium; &longs;ic ve&longs;ica aëre plena &longs;ur&longs;um attollit oleum, vel aliud
quidpiam aqua levius, longè velociore motu, quàm &longs;ibi ip&longs;i relictum, in eo­
dem medio moveretur; denique non &longs;emel ob&longs;ervavi, medium canaliculi
&longs;egmentum aqua plenum, quæ minimè de&longs;cendebat, licèt vis gravitatis, vi
po&longs;&longs;e&longs;&longs;ionis deor&longs;um accederet, ratio e&longs;t, quia minima vis ponderis brevis
&longs;egmenti aquæ canaliculo contentæ vix &longs;uperare pote&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentiam tra­
jectionis, de qua &longs;upra fusè actum e&longs;t.
Chry&longs;ocom.

Benè e&longs;t; &longs;i quid fortè re&longs;tat, ex dictis facilè intelligetur; ex­
perimenta ab Autore &longs;upra laudato in lucem edita longiorem operam,
eamque fortè difficiliorem po&longs;tulant, vt ad principia phy&longs;ica reducantur;
quare in alium congre&longs;&longs;um, quando vobis commodum erit, remittenda e&longs;&longs;e
putarem.
Antim.

Ita pror&longs;us mihi faciendum videtur; quod verò dicis, rem diffi­
ciliorem fore, dare profecto non po&longs;&longs;um; nihil enim à me lectum in dicti
Autoris libro, quod & &longs;ummoperè mihi non placuerit, & ad &longs;uas cau&longs;as ex
jactis principiis facile reduci non po&longs;&longs;it; quod vt palam fiat, in proximo
congre&longs;&longs;u procurabo; quem &longs;tatim po&longs;t Eminenti&longs;&longs;imi reditum inituri &longs;u­
mus; Interea mi Augu&longs;tine, &longs;i quid duxeris &longs;citu dignum, ex iis quæ in his
quatuor congre&longs;&longs;ibus di&longs;cu&longs;&longs;imus, de his, tuos illos docti&longs;&longs;imos, & quos plu­
rimi facio Academicos, certiores facias, velim.
Augu&longs;tin.

Non monitus hoc facere cogitaveram, vt &longs;altem videant,
vtrùm hæc cum accurati&longs;&longs;imis illorum experimentis con&longs;entiant; quan­
quam de hoc vix dubito; præ&longs;ertim cùm illa omnia, &longs;uppo&longs;ita illa materia
ten&longs;a, &longs;atis feliciter explicueris, quæ alij accer&longs;ita vacui opera, vel compre&longs;­
&longs;ionis, vel ætheris, vel Cylindri aëris explicant, quàm ægrè ac difficulter, ex
dictis huc v&longs;que &longs;atis &longs;uperque compertum vobis e&longs;t.
Antim.

Valete igitur &longs;electi&longs;&longs;ima rei litera Capita, & &longs;i minùs expe­
ctationi, & opinioni de me ve&longs;træ fecerim &longs;at, vt nugas meas nihili duca­
tis, ita tenuitati me vestræ vltro igno&longs;catis, velim.
Typographus Lectori.

GRATVLARIS haud dubiè mihi (Amice
Lector) quòd, contra quàm à pleri&longs;que &longs;olet,
nihil ad hujus operis commendationem, initio
Præfari voluerim.

A&longs;cititiis quippe non egent
pigmentis quæ per &longs;e pulchra, & eximia &longs;unt.

Satis igi­
tur habui per celebre Autoris nomen hi&longs;ce Dialogis præfigere;
vt te ad legendum invitarem: ratus (quod haud dubiè con­
tigit) te &longs;tatim pellectum &longs;ubtili&longs;&longs;imi fœcunditate ingenij,
per amœnáque rerum varietate, ac expeditâ dicendi me­
thodo irretitum, eam quam ip&longs;e debes huic operi commenda
tionem facturum.

Quia verò plurimùm intere&longs;t, vt ma­
gnorum hominum ne levi&longs;&longs;ima quidem monumenta intereant;
Velímque vt etiam mihi aliquid debeas; &longs;ubripui propemo­
dùm, quas hic attexo, no&longs;tri Autoris Epi&longs;tolas, ad præ&longs;tanti&longs;&longs;i­
mum, & in re literaria, curio&longs;áque Philo&longs;ophia ver&longs;ati&longs;&longs;i­
mum virum Dominum Claudium Ba&longs;&longs;et, ob&longs;ervanti&longs;&longs;imum,
& conjuncti&longs;&longs;imum Amicum datas.

Novas exhibent Ob&longs;er­
vationes, quæ maximè &longs;unt hujus loci: cum ad Saturni, Io­
ví&longs;que &longs;i&longs;temata, & ad ea quæ duobus prioribus Dialogis
tractata &longs;unt, pertineant.

Pauca hæc accipe (Lector Bene­
vole) intereà dum grandiora prodeunt eju&longs;dem Autoris volu­
mina, quibus quidquid in vniver&longs;a natura, & in omnibus
ferè di&longs;ciplinis reconditum e&longs;t, novâ planè methodo, noví&longs;que,
ac curio&longs;is omninò inventis explicatur.
Vale.

PRÆSTANTISSIMO VIRO
CLAVDIO BASSET
HONORATVS FABRI. S.P.D.

EX quo Dialogos meos ad te mi&longs;i, vir ornati&longs;&longs;ime, nonnul­
la inter ob&longs;ervandum mihi occurrerunt, de quibus te certio­
rem faciendum e&longs;&longs;e duxi: movit me ad ob&longs;ervandum, &longs;che­
ma quoddam Saturnij &longs;ytematis, æ&longs;tate præterita, in vrbe
à nonnullis in lucem editum, in quo cum annuli Saturnij
planum ab eo paralleli&longs;mo, quem huc v&longs;que obtinere vi­
&longs;um e&longs;t, cum Æquatoris plano, totis ferè 10. vel 11. gradibus deflexi&longs;&longs;e vi­
deretur, cœlum con&longs;ulendum e&longs;&longs;e putavi, vt vel novum Phenomenon ne­
gligerem, &longs;i &longs;ecus probaret ob&longs;ervatio, vel meo calculo donarem, &longs;i tale,
pror&longs;us exhiberetur: ad explorandum igitur me accinxi Tele&longs;copio 25.Pal­
morum adhibito, divinianis lentibus accurati&longs;&longs;imè, pro more, elaboratis in­
&longs;tructo: Saturnius annulus &longs;tatim meis oculis ita &longs;e &longs;ubjecit, vt &longs;umma eju&longs;­
dem annuli portio &longs;upra &longs;ummum globi verticem, media ferè latitudinis
annuli parte a&longs;&longs;urgeret, infra verò imam globi portionem, ima prædicti an­
nuli de&longs;cenderet, eo ferè modo, quo in excu&longs;o &longs;chemate repræ&longs;entabatur:
&longs;ed vix elap&longs;o modico temporis &longs;patio, &longs;ummam portionem annuli infra
&longs;ummam portionem globi, infimam item globi infra imam annuli deprimi,
clari&longs;&longs;imè a&longs;pexi; vtriu&longs;que Phenomeni facies alternis vicibus &longs;e&longs;e mihi
exhibuit, non tantùm &longs;emel iterúmque, &longs;ed toties, quoties vitrum, Satur­
num versùs converti.

Ob&longs;ervavi etiam, nigras illas auriculas, &longs;eu lacunas
globum inter & annulum contentas, modò contrahi, modò explicari, con­
trahi quidem, depre&longs;&longs;a &longs;uprema portione annuli infra &longs;ummam globi, illa
verò a&longs;&longs;urgente, dilatari & explicari.

Ob&longs;ervavi præterea, projectam à glo­
bo Saturni vmbram, &longs;ecundùm &longs;olatum radium, in &longs;upremam portionem
annuli, dextror&longs;um &longs;cilicet, Ortum versùs, propter &longs;itum Solis Occidenta­
lem, ita vt per planum annuli, niger tractus ire videretur, qui, vt modò ap­
paret, ita mox expungitur, alternis vicibus, vt &longs;upra jam dixi.

Cuncta hæc
cum Divino no&longs;tro, alii&longs;que ob&longs;ervandi peritis hominibus &longs;æpè ac &longs;æpius
ob&longs;ervavi.

Nec difficilè fuit, hujus Phœnomeni cau&longs;am indagare; &longs;i enim &longs;uppona­
mus, huc illuc nutare ac librari planum annuli, circa majorem Diametrum
apparentis ellip&longs;eos, &longs;cilicet Au&longs;trum versùs & Boream, illa omnia haud du-
biè &longs;uccedere debent; nempe vbi &longs;uprema portio annuli versùs Boream, ima
versùs Au&longs;trum accedit, hæc infra imam globi de&longs;cendit, illa &longs;upra &longs;um­
mam attollitur, explicantur lacunæ, vmbra, &longs;eu niger ille tractus à radiis &longs;o­
laribus in planum annuli liberè appul&longs;is expungitur; vbi verò &longs;uprema an­
nuli ad Au&longs;trum, ima ad Boream deflectit, &longs;uprema globi portio &longs;upra &longs;um­
mam annuli, infima infra infimam extat, contrahuntur lacunæ, & vmbra
projecta, &longs;ecundùm nigrum tractum, planum annuli &longs;ecat.

Hujus porrò nutationis, &longs;eu tremulæ Librationis annuli cau&longs;a in prom­
ptu e&longs;t; nempe cum ea vi polleat annuli planum, qua prædictum paralleli&longs;­
mum cum Æquatoris plano retineat, in toto illo declinationis tractu, tum
versùs Au&longs;trum, tum versùs boream, continuum ni&longs;um exerit, ad hunc fi­
nem obtinendum; idque motu quodam accelerato, cujus perfectam analo­
giam habemus in funependulis, in chordis pul&longs;atis, in reciproco Planetarum
motu ab Apogæo ad Perigæum, &c.

Quo fit, vt terminum illum, ad quem
tendit, &longs;emper excedat, eatque &longs;emper, redeátque vici&longs;&longs;im, vt videre e&longs;t in
exemplis &longs;upra indicatis.

Cur verò hæc Libratio, &longs;eu nutatio fiat circa majorem Diametrum ap­
parentis ellip&longs;eos, &longs;atis manife&longs;tum e&longs;t; cum hæc Diameter lineam mo­
tus annuli dirigat, ac proinde eidem parallela e&longs;&longs;e debeat; cujus rei analo­
giam habemus in omnibus aliis mobilibus planis; &longs;ic enim totum annuli
planum eidem lineæ parallelum manet, juxta commune principium do­
ctrinæ motuum, cujus mentionem feci in Dialogis, quo fit, vt mobile &longs;uo
nutui relictum, eo motu moveatur, quo faciliùs moveri pote&longs;t.

Inde autem per&longs;picua ratio ducitur hujus paralleli&longs;mi, nempe planum il­
lud parallelum e&longs;&longs;e debet plano illius circuli, in quo movetur, juxta prædi­
ctum principium; &longs;ed movetur in circulo diurno, parallelo &longs;cilicet Æquato­
ris plano, quid mirum igitur, &longs;i planum annuli Æquatoris plano paralle­
lum &longs;it: & verò inde facilis ratio ducitur, propter quam Deus Naturæ Au­
tor planum illud annuli, in dicto &longs;itu, circa Saturni globum collocavit, ni­
mirum vt vi&longs;ibile argumentum oculis mortalium, fideli Tele&longs;copio in&longs;tru­
ctis &longs;ubjiceret, contra terræ motum; nempe in eo circulo dictus annulus
movetur, cujus plano planum annuli parallelum e&longs;t; cum igitur parallelum
&longs;it plano circuli diurni, & planum hujus, plano Æquatoris, in circulo diurno
prædictus annulus movetur, non verò in Ecliptica; vnde Terræ globum quie&longs;­
cere, nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t: tanti momenti fuerit, fal&longs;am illam hypothe&longs;im de&longs;truere, vt
Divina Providentia, eam dedocere, & illius fal&longs;itatem vi&longs;ibili argumento
Mortalibus demon&longs;trare dignata &longs;it; non e&longs;t igitur, quod aliqui dicant, præ­
dictum annulum commentitium e&longs;&longs;e, nullo v&longs;u, commodo & fine in cœlis
de&longs;criptum; cum Deus illum, ad finem adeò nobilem & penè nece&longs;&longs;arium
condiderit, & in eo &longs;itu collocârit; nimirum ad errorem illum de terræ mo­
tu multorum animis tam altè in&longs;itum, penitùs abolendum; vnde non dubi­
to, quin aliqui dicturi &longs;int, majorem illam Diametrum apparentis ellip&longs;eos
plano Æquatoris, id e&longs;t, tangenti circuli diurni punctum, in quo Saturni
globus &longs;itus e&longs;t parallelam non e&longs;&longs;e: &longs;ed no&longs;tris, oculis credimus, in&longs;igni
Tele&longs;copio in&longs;tructis; acto enim tran&longs;ver&longs;o filo non procul à lente oculari,
reticulo item probè divi&longs;o, immò adhibito organo, circa mundi axem ver­
tibili, quantum per&longs;pici & ob&longs;ervari potuit, parallelam e&longs;&longs;e comperi­
mus, repetita &longs;æpe ac &longs;æpius Ob&longs;ervatione; accedit, quod Galileus, Ga&longs;­
&longs;endus, Bugliardus, Ricciolus, Hugenius, prima &longs;cilicet rei A&longs;tronomicæ
capita, huic &longs;ententiæ &longs;uffragantur; te&longs;tes oculatos appellare po&longs;&longs;em, &longs;ed ab­
&longs;tineo; quia mihi, etiam non jurato, facilè fidem habebis & hæc de Saturno
&longs;int &longs;atis; ad Iovem orationem converto.

In Iovis di&longs;co, vmbras à Iovialibus Stellis projectas videri, aliqui æ&longs;tate
præterita, in vrbe divulgarunt, nos illas nunquam ob&longs;ervare potuimus, ne­
que id, opinor, Tele&longs;copij no&longs;tri vitio qui&longs;piam imputet, quod adeò probè
laboratum erat, vt cum Palmos 25. longum e&longs;&longs;et, acuti&longs;&longs;imam, vt vocant,
lentem &longs;u&longs;tineret, quæ &longs;cilicet per&longs;picillo &longs;equi palmum longo compete­
bat; immò fortè Stellam ip&longs;am &longs;ub Iovis di&longs;co euntem, per mediam fa&longs;ciam,
quæ paulò ob&longs;curior e&longs;t, tertiam præ&longs;ertim cæterarum fulgenti&longs;&longs;imam, po­
tiùs quàm illius vmbram videremus; nunquam tamen illam vidimus; licèt
nobis perinde &longs;it, &longs;ive Mediceæ &longs;ub Iovem de&longs;cendant, &longs;ive &longs;upra Iovem
&longs;emper maneant, cum æquè facilè illarum motum explicemus: Vt vt &longs;it,
intra paucos dies, Tele&longs;copium 60. palmos longum adhibebimus, eju&longs;que
opera, litem hanc terminabimus.

In eodem Iovis di&longs;co, tres fa&longs;cias ob&longs;ervavimus, circulo diurno ferè pa­
rallelas, quod eadem arte, de qua &longs;upra, exploravimus; dixi ferè, nam ver­
sùs occa&longs;um, qua&longs;i in cuneum contrahuntur, vna autem præ cæteris, minùs
diluta & magis con&longs;picua, in &longs;emidi&longs;co Boreali, luculentior apparet, in qua
duo qua&longs;i Nodi probè rotundi apparent, à centro fa&longs;ciæ hinc inde æquè
di&longs;&longs;iti, qua&longs;i quarta parte eju&longs;dem longitudinis, quorum Diameter eju&longs;dem
fa&longs;ciæ latitudinem &longs;uperat, & hinc inde tantulum extat; quid &longs;i fortè à non­
nullis hi Nodi vmbrarum projectarum loco habiti &longs;unt; vmbræ tamen non
&longs;unt, projectæ &longs;cilicet à Mediceis, cum &longs;emper in eodem &longs;itu maneant, &
&longs;emper apparcant; Mediceæ verò eo &longs;emper loco non &longs;int, vt in Iovis di&longs;­
cum vmbram projiciant.

Prædictas fa&longs;cias aliquando non videri, liquidò con&longs;tat, &longs;ed tantùm pro
vario Solis & Iovis &longs;itu; ex quo fit, vt &longs;int vmbræ projectæ à continuo tra­
ctu alti&longs;&longs;imorum montium, ab ortu in occa&longs;um excurrentium, ac ferè pa­
rallelorum plano Æquatoris; vnde luculenter etiam deducimus, Iovem in
eo &longs;itu &longs;emper e&longs;&longs;e, juxta communem doctrinam motuum, de qua &longs;uprà, vt
circuli diurni plano prædictus montium tractus qua&longs;i parallelus &longs;it, &longs;ic enim
faciliùs in eo movetur, vt jam de annulo Saturnio &longs;upra dictum fuit.

Dixi,
qua&longs;i, quia omnino parallelus non e&longs;t, &longs;ed Borealis fa&longs;cia versùs occa&longs;um ad
alias modicum inclinat, ad in&longs;tar cunei, vt dixi; hoc enim facilioris motus
ratio po&longs;tulat, vt videre e&longs;t, in motu navium, Avium, & omnium ferè pro­
jectorum.

Hinc autem aliud argumentum vi&longs;ibile deducitur, ad demon&longs;tran­
dum immobilis telluris &longs;tatum; prædictus enim Iovialium montium &longs;itus
Iovem in circulo diurno moveri demon&longs;trat; en tibi alterum &longs;ingularis Dei
providentiæ &longs;pecimen, qui cum futurum majoris Tele&longs;copij v&longs;um prævi­
deret, talem Iovialium montium tractum & &longs;itum e&longs;&longs;e voluit, vt ex vmbris
projectis, & &longs;ub a&longs;pectum no&longs;trum adductis, majoris Tele&longs;copij opera, Io­
vem in circulo diurno moveri, ac proinde terræ globum con&longs;i&longs;tere, homi­
nes intelligerent: fa&longs;ciarum porro limbum non rectum, &longs;ed qua&longs;i denticu­
latum e&longs;&longs;e, nonnulli dixerunt, quod reverà &longs;i verum &longs;it, ex inæquali & a&longs;pe­
rato dictorum montium jugo provenit; cum inde a&longs;peratam quoque &
inæqualem projectæ vmbræ marginem e&longs;&longs;e nece&longs;&longs;e &longs;it.

Quod verò &longs;pectat ad 4. Stellas Ioviales, &longs;eu Mediceas, illarum motum
jam ferè per 60.dies indefe&longs;&longs;i ob&longs;ervamus, exploratis & ad certas men&longs;uras
redactis iis intervallis, quibus, à Iovis di&longs;co, &longs;ingulis diebus recedunt, vel ad
illum accedunt: pro communi autem men&longs;ura Iovis Diametrum accepimus,
appo&longs;ito, non procul ab oculari lente, intra tubum, reticulo, ex caballinis
&longs;atis contexto, ac divi&longs;o in 24.partes æquales, hoc e&longs;t, in totidem lentis &longs;e­
midigitos; digitum enim pro more appellare liceat duodecimam Diametri
lentis partem; quilibet porro &longs;emidigitus Diametrum di&longs;ci Iovialis adæ­
quabat; hujus demum reticuli opera, multa accuratè ob&longs;ervavimus; puta
di&longs;tantias Iovialium à Iovis centro, maximam hinc inde illarum digre&longs;&longs;io­
nem, integræ revolutionis periodum, & motum diurnum, &longs;cilicet apparen­
tem; nullo enim alio motu gaudent, quàm eo, qui reliquis Sphæris cæle&longs;ti­
bus competit, nimirum ab ortu in occa&longs;um; vbi enim &longs;uum orbem citiùs
decurrunt, quàm Iupiter &longs;uum, hunc &longs;anè po&longs;t &longs;e relinquunt, versùs ortum,
à puncto conjunctionis; vbi tardiùs; versùs ortum à Iove recedere viden­
tur, citius verò decurrunt, à maxima digre&longs;&longs;ione ortiva ad occiduam, per
Perigæum, tardiùs ab occidua ad ortivam, per Apogæum.

Cæterùm vnum accidit, quod multis, opinor, mirum videbitur, motum
&longs;cilicet diurnum apparentem eju&longs;dem Stellæ Mediceæ, in &longs;patiis ferè æqua­
libus fieri, quantum &longs;altem ob&longs;ervari à nobis potuit, in ea linea, quæ per
Iovis centrum ferè ducitur, temporibus &longs;cilicet æqualibus v.g. quarta Me­
dicea, à conjunctione Apogæi, ad conjunctionem Perigæi pervenit, diebus 8.
horis 9. min.36. & &longs;ingulis diebus conficere videtur in linea recta per Io­
vis centrum proximè ducta, Diametros Iovis 2 1/2. paulò plus, vnde maxima
illius digre&longs;&longs;io e&longs;t Diametrorum Iovis 11. tertia &longs;ingulis diebus, decurrit
Iovis Diametros 3 1/2. integra illius revolutio e&longs;t, dierum 7. hor. 14. min.17.
maxima digre&longs;&longs;io, Diametrorum 6.

Secundæ motus diurnus in eadem li­
nea recta e&longs;t 5. Diametr. integra revolutio dier.

3. hor. 14.min. 24. maxima
digre&longs;&longs;io Diametr. 4 2/.

primæ denique motus diurnus Diametr. 6 1/2. paulò
plus, maxima digre&longs;&longs;io Diametr. 3.integra revolutio.

Dier.1.hor.18.min.30.
hæc ob&longs;ervatio vige&longs;ies &longs;altem a nobis repetita, eodem &longs;emper eventu fuit;
& licèt interdum quarta, vel tertia Diametri parte falleret, in vitium ob­
&longs;ervationis facilè referri pote&longs;t, cum de paucis dumtaxat &longs;ecundis hoc lo­
co agatur: in circulo, tum concentrico Iovis orbi, tum excentrico, multo
longiùs à vero Medicearum &longs;itu & loco in&longs;titutum calculum deflexi&longs;&longs;e,
demon&longs;travit eventus: non negatim tamen, circa conjunctiones, &longs;patia diur­
no illo mota paulo majora decurri; ita vt primæ Stellæ Mediceæ motus 7.
Diametrorum e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;it.

Secundæ 5 1/2. tertiæ 4. quartæ 3. &longs;ed parum pro
nihilo computatur, & &longs;tatim exce&longs;&longs;us &longs;equenti defectu compen&longs;atur; cum
circa maximas digre&longs;&longs;iones, paulò minora decurrantur.

Ex his colligo, Mediceas fortè moveri in axe Geminæ Parabolæ, ba&longs;e
communi Apogæo ad Perigæum, & vici&longs;&longs;im, juxta normam motus natura­
liter accelerati & retardati; in applicatis verò, motu æquabili, ac proinde
non moveri in circulo circa Iovem, vt jam aliàs in opu&longs;culo contra Hu­
genianam a&longs;&longs;ertionem indicavi; nempe &longs;i moverentur in circulo, &longs;patia
cre&longs;cerent juxta rationem &longs;inuum rectorum ab Apogæo ad digre&longs;&longs;ionem
ortivam, & ab hac ad Perigæum, juxta rationem &longs;inuum ver&longs;orum; ac proin­
de temporibus æqualibus, inæqualia &longs;patia decurrerentur in dicta linea re­
cta.

Vtrùm verò Mediceæ infra Iovem de&longs;cendant, aliàs dubitavi, jam mi­
hi veri&longs;imile videtur, de&longs;cendere, tum quia vmbra illarum in Iovis di&longs;cum
projicitur, vt aliqui ob&longs;ervarunt, quamvis ego non item; tum quia ex alia
ob&longs;ervatione, hoc ip&longs;um evinci videtur; nempe vbi Medicea ab Apogæo
versùs ortum progreditur, & vbi primùm apparet à limbo Iovis ortivo di&longs;­
&longs;ita e&longs;t, non modico intervallo, vt &longs;æpe ac &longs;æpius ob&longs;ervavi, elap&longs;is proxi­
mè Men&longs;ibus; quod certè ex Iovis vmbra provenit, ita projecta, ob Solis &longs;i­
tum, vt illa dextror&longs;um, ortum versùs deflectat: at vbi eadem Stella ad Io­
vis Pærigæum accedit, &longs;emper apparet, donec in ip&longs;um Iovis di&longs;cum om­
nino immergatur, & probè illa di&longs;cernitur, licèt limbum Iovis ortivum
tangat; nulla igitur vmbra occurrit; igitur &longs;upra Iovem non e&longs;t.

Benè e&longs;t, inquies, gratulor, &longs;ententiam mutas, nempe aliàs, infra Iovem
ire, negabas; impugnabas item Saturnium Annulum; modò vtrumque ad­
&longs;truis.

Sententiam non muto; &longs;entiebam enim antea, non con&longs;tare ex ob&longs;er­
vationibus, eò v&longs;que mihi per&longs;pectis, Mediceas infra Iovem de&longs;cendere;
&longs;ed jam ex novis ob&longs;eruationibus, &longs;ecus evenit, & nova lux ex iis affulget,
quæ ex prioribus non afful&longs;erat: Saturnium verò annulum omnino nega&longs;&longs;e
non memini; id enim dumtaxat à me a&longs;&longs;ertum e&longs;t, omnes Saturniani &longs;y&longs;te­
matis Figuras, eo v&longs;que à variis Autoribus delineatas, adhibitis globulis,
explicari po&longs;&longs;e; hoc tamen non vetat, quin &longs;ecus &longs;entiam, vbi novæ ob&longs;er­
vationes ad&longs;unt, quales &longs;e&longs;e mihi, elap&longs;is proximè men&longs;ibus, exhibuerunt;
quamvis autem mihi veri&longs;imile &longs;it, annulum illum Saturnio globo circum­
ductum e&longs;&longs;e, & vix aliter præ&longs;ens Phœnomenon explicari po&longs;&longs;it, &longs;u&longs;tineo ta­
men, dum Saturnus in via lactea &longs;itus &longs;it, quod reverà brevi futurum e&longs;t,
redeatque ad Æquatorem, quod non ni&longs;i po&longs;t &longs;eptem, vel octo annos ha­
bituri &longs;umus.

Sed finem Scribendi facio, vir præ&longs;tanti&longs;&longs;imè, ne prolixior
Epi&longs;tola tibi mole&longs;tiam afferat; aliàs plura, &longs;i hæc pauca grata tibi accidi&longs;&longs;e,
tuo commodo, mihi &longs;ignificaris; interim plurimùm Vale; Scribebam in
vrbe Kalendis Novembris, Anni currentis æræ 1664.
PRÆSTANTISSIMO VIRO CLAVDIO BASSET HONORATVS FABRI. S.P.D.

ANTE aliquot dies, vir Præ&longs;tanti&longs;&longs;imè, po&longs;tulatis tuis
lace&longs;&longs;itus, de Iovialium, &longs;eu Medicearum Stellarum &longs;y­
&longs;temate, pauca &longs;crip&longs;i; jam nonnulla mihi addenda vi­
dentur, vt res i&longs;ta paulò accuratiùs di&longs;cu&longs;&longs;a re&longs;tet.

Si quid
po&longs;tulaveris vltra, dabo gnavam operam, vt tibi à me illi­
co fiat &longs;atis.

Sit ergo linea AE ducta per centrum Iovis, & v&longs;que ad centrum terræ
(quam in Mundi centro &longs;uppono immobilem) producta; &longs;it A Apogæum
quartæ Mediceæ, E Perigæum, maxima digre&longs;&longs;io ortiva DF. 11. circiter
Diametrorum Iovis: &longs;uppono, prædictam Mediceam æquali cum Iove
motu, reali &longs;cilicet, circa Mundi centrum, ab ortu in occa&longs;um moveri: &
quia DF continet ad &longs;ummum 12. minuta prima, quamvis alioquin &longs;it ar­
cus orbitæ Iovis, a&longs;&longs;umo tamen illam ad in&longs;tar lineæ rectæ, cum phy&longs;icè vix
à recta deflectat: &longs;uppono deinde, Iovem moveri versùs G ad occa&longs;um &
& &longs;imul vnà cum illo, quartam Mediceam versùs H ; &longs;ed cum hæc circu-
lum diurnum majorem de&longs;cribat, eam Iupiter haud dubiè antecedit, &
po&longs;t &longs;e relinquit, versùs ortum; & perinde illa &longs;e habet, quò ad apparen­
tem motum, atque &longs;i versùs ortum &longs;eu versùs T à Iove di&longs;cedens move­
retur: Itaque, &longs;i &longs;upponamus, vna cum Iove, moveri rectas EA, FG, cir­
ca idem Mundi centrum, quartam Mediceam ab A versùs T, appatenti &
æquabili motu, ire nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t.

Cum verò ab Apogæo A, ad mediocrem di&longs;tantiam D motu accelera­
to feratur, &longs;it datum tempus, quo ab A perveniret in T, &longs;i hoc dumtaxat
motu accelerato, item quo perveniret in T, &longs;i primo illo dumtaxat æqua­
bili moveretur, haud dubiè &longs;i vtroque &longs;imul, mixto &longs;cilicet ex æqua­
bili per AT, & accelerato per AD, dato illo tempore, perveniet in F, per
&longs;emiparabolam ACF, cujus axis e&longs;t AD, & ba&longs;is DF.

Si autem datum illud tempus in duo tempora æqualia dividatur; cer­
tè primo tempore, totius prioris dimidio, motu accelerato, acquiret AB,
quæ e&longs;t .

AD, iuxta doctrinam motuum; & ducta applicata BC, cum
perpendiculari NC, motu illo æquabili æquiret AN, dimidiam AT,
vel DF ; quia vt AD ad AB, ita Quadratum DF ad Quadratum BC ;
igirur motu mixto ex vtroque, acquiret AC; &longs;ecundo verò tempore, pri­
mo motu acquiret, BD altero NT, mixto ex vtroque CF, demi&longs;&longs;a por­
rò perpendiculati NCS, licet Medicea &longs;it reverà in C, tran&longs;acto primo
tempore, videtur tamen in S ; quia hæc in eodem proximè cum Iove pla­
no movetur; igitur ita re videtur apparenti motu per rectam DF, &longs;cilicet
proximè, vt temporibus æqualibus, æqualia ferè &longs;patia decurrat, quod certè
no&longs;tris ob&longs;ervationibus toties repetitis mirificè con&longs;entit.

Vbi autem Medicea pervenit in F, æqualem cum Iove orbem decurrit; igi­
tur æquè citò, nec ab eo vltra regreditur; quia tamen ab hac mediocri
di&longs;tantia, tendit ad Perigæum E, motu retardato, circulum diurnum, diurno
Iovis minorem de&longs;cribere incipit; citiùs igitur illum ab&longs;olvit; vnde ver­
sùs occa&longs;um, ad Iovem accedat, nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t; & cum juxta doctrinam mo­
tuum, quo tempore, motu naturaliter accelerato, datum &longs;patium decurri­
tur, æquale huic, retardato percurratur; certè, quo tempore ab A pervenit
in F, motu mixto ex accelerato & æquabili, ab F pervenit in E motu mix­
to ex retardato & æquabili; & quo tempore à C pervenit in F, & ab A in
C; ab F pervenit in Z, & à Z in E, quod e&longs;t Perigæum; eodem modo ab E
pervenit in G, mixto ex accelerato & æquabili, & à G in A mixto ex re­
tardato & æquabili.

Sic habes duas Parabolas AFEG, communi ba&longs;i
FG.

Sed vt aliquid de calculatione Iovialium dicam: &longs;uppono; integram
revolutionem quartæ Mediceæ ab&longs;olvi diebus 16. hor.19.min.12. &longs;eu mi­
nutis 24192. accipio quartam partem, &longs;cilicet 6043. quibus ab A venit in
F. &longs;uppono igitur DF divi&longs;am in partes æquales 6048. item DG; &longs;uppo­
no demum certam Epocham, id e&longs;t certum temporis punctum, quo Medi­
ceam e&longs;&longs;e in Apogæo A, con&longs;tet; & ab eo tot dies fluxi&longs;&longs;e, puta 7. id e&longs;t
min. 10080. divido hunc numerum per 6043. & venit quotiens I cum re­
&longs;iduo 4032. Vnde colligo, Mediceam decurri&longs;&longs;e &longs;emel DF, & ab F versùs
D, confeci&longs;&longs;e 4032. partes, quibus &longs;ubtractis ex 6048. &longs;uper&longs;unt 2016.hæc
erit applicata, quæ ad locum Mediceæ quæ&longs;itum terminatur: vnde habeo
di&longs;tantiam ab E Perigæo nempe &longs;it vt DF, ad applicatam juventam, &longs;cili­
cet 6048. ad 2016. ita hæc ad tertiam; certè vt erit DF ad illam tertiam,
id e&longs;t, vt Quadratum 6048. ad Quadratum 2016. ita DE ad aliam, quæ
erit men&longs;ura di&longs;tantiæ à Perigæo.

Si verò quotiens &longs;it major 4. & &longs;it v.g. 7. cum re&longs;iduo 3000. &longs;ubtra­
ctis 4. ex 7. &longs;uper&longs;unt 3. & 3000. partes, a&longs;&longs;umendæ à puncto G in D, vt
habeatur locus Mediceæ quæ&longs;itus, &longs;i quotiens &longs;it 9. plus 5000. &longs;ubtra­
ctis 4. ex 9, bis, &longs;upere&longs;t 1. plus 5000. a&longs;&longs;umendæ ab F versùs D ; pro qui­
bus eodem modo quo &longs;upra calculus procedet: immò Gemina Parabola
AFEG in 12. Signa dividi po&longs;&longs;et, a&longs;&longs;umptis tamen gradibus æqualibus
in rectis FD, GD. eadem ratio facit pro aliis Mediceis, & hoc vnum
dumtaxat di&longs;crimen e&longs;t, quod i&longs;tæ minores Parabolas, concentricas tamen
majori de&longs;cribant, & quod &longs;ingularum diver&longs;a &longs;it periodus maxima item
digre&longs;&longs;io diver&longs;a.
Ex dictis quædam deduco, & in certa capita di&longs;tingo.

Primò, Diametri Iovis eadem &longs;emper men&longs;ura non e&longs;t; hæc enim mi­
nor e&longs;t, Iove ad Apogæum, major verò, ad Perigæum accedente, idque
ex communi Opticæ regula; propiora enim &longs;ub majore angulo videntur;
hinc idem reticulum vtroque tempore adhibitum fallit.

Secundò, Hinc etiam maximæ digre&longs;&longs;ionis men&longs;ura minor apparet,
Iove non procul ab Apogæo &longs;ito, major verò, dum hic ad Perigæum
accedit, propter eandem rationem; hoc tamen non facit, vt eju&longs;dem Me­
diceæ maxima digre&longs;&longs;io modò plures, modò pauciores Iovis Diametros
contineat; cre&longs;cit enim & decre&longs;cit vtraque proportionaliter.

Tertiò, Facit tamen altitudinis Planetæ differentia, vt tardiùs Iupiter in
circulo diurno moveri videatur, quando accedit ad Apogæum ; velociùs ve­
rò, ad Perigæum; quia idem &longs;patium in majore circulo minorem arcum
continet, in minore, majorem.

Quartò, Methodus illa &longs;tatuendi veram di&longs;tantiam Mediceæ à centro
Iovis, numeratis funependuli vibrationibus, ad definiendum tempus,
quo &longs;patium interjectum decurritur, ex duplici capite fallit; primò quia
fortè omnes illæ vibrationes I&longs;ochronæ non &longs;unt; &longs;ecundò quia quò Iupi­
ter altior e&longs;t, dato tempore, in circulo diurno, minorem arcum conficit; re­
&longs;tat igitur, prædictam di&longs;tantiæ men&longs;uram, adhibito reticulo, longè me­
liùs & accuratiùs con&longs;titui.
Quintò, Maxima Mediceæ digre&longs;&longs;io duobus modis à me &longs;tatuitur.

Primò dato motu diurno, data etiam &longs;patiorum æqualium, hoc motu
confectorum ju&longs;ta men&longs;ura; dato demum Mediceæ ad maximam digre&longs;­
&longs;ionem proximè accedentis ob&longs;ervato loco, puta in Y, &longs;eptima po&longs;t Me­
ridiem hora, die &longs;equenti; eadem hora, dicta Medicea &longs;it in X ; divi­
datur YX, in P, tum a&longs;&longs;umpta PF æquali dimidiæ motus diurni men­
&longs;uræ; erit F maximæ digre&longs;&longs;ionis quæ&longs;itus limes.

Secundò ob&longs;ervato
emer&longs;ionis ex vmbra projecta momento; v.g. &longs;it vmbra projecta DK,
& Medicea, vbi primùm emergit ex vmbra, videatur in M, habetur di­
&longs;tantia MD, quæ e&longs;t ba&longs;is trianguli DK M, habetur etiam angulus DKM;
quia cogno&longs;citur locus, tum Solis, tum Iovis; habentur igitur alia late­
ra trianguli; habetur igitur DK, radius Epicycli Mediceæ ; hæc autem
maximæ digre&longs;&longs;ionis men&longs;ura vulgò ponitur : &longs;ed profectò fallit; quia
cum bis ac tertiò ob&longs;ervarim quartam Mediceam emergentem, & accura­
tè meritus fuerim illius di&longs;tantiam, eo temporis momento, à centro Iovis,
puta MD, certè DK longè minor eva&longs;it, quam DF ; hic ergo modus, vt
fallax, rejiciendus e&longs;t.

Sextò, Rectè autem deduco, Mediceam non moveri in circulo circa
Iovem, non modò ex &longs;patiis æqualibus, diurno motu confectis à Medi­
cea, in recta FG, &longs;i enim ex Apogæo G, per Quadrantem circuli GPE,
ire &longs;upponatur, a&longs;&longs;umptis arcubus æqualibus GMPRE, ducti&longs;que re­
ctis MZ, PY, RV parallelis GA, videbitur decurrere &longs;patia AZYVE
omnino inæqualia: &longs;ed æqualibus temporibus æqualia decurrere vide­
tur; igitur non modo ex &longs;patiis æqualibus, æquali tempore, in recta per
centrum Iovis eunte, à Medicea decur&longs;is, deduco, illam non moveri in
circulo circa Iovem, &longs;ed etiam ex eo quod, primùm emergens minùs di­
&longs;tet à centro Iovis, quàm di&longs;tare deberet, cùm enim di&longs;tantia Iovis
à terra &longs;it ferè quintupla di&longs;tantiæ Solis, ac proinde angulus maxi­
mæ Pro&longs;thaphære&longs;eos &longs;it ferè 11. grad. min. 32. Sit centrum Iovis A,
maxima digre&longs;&longs;io quartæ Mediceæ AE. 11. circiter Diametrorum Iovis,
vt mihi con&longs;tat ex multis ob&longs;ervationibus, &longs;it Quadrans ortivus Epiclyci
GE, & Apogæum G, &longs;it angulus GAK 11. grad.min. 32. &longs;it BA Semi­
diameter Iovis, ducatur BL parallela AK, item NS, &longs;ectio vmbræ pro­
jectæ erit Parallelogramma NL, di&longs;tante Sole versùs occa&longs;um grad. 78.
min. 28. in quo puncto angulus Pro&longs;thaphære&longs;eos e&longs;t 11. grad. min. 32.
igitur in L e&longs;t punctum emer&longs;ionis quartæ Mediceæ ; demittatur LD, Me­
dicea primùm emergens videbitur in D ; continet autem DA Diametros
Iovis 2 .

Sed contrarium, repetitis ob&longs;ervationibus, comperi, &longs;cilicet quar­
tam Mediceam primùm emergentem ex vmbra projecta, à Iovis centro viæ
di&longs;tare duabus integris Diametris.

Septimò, Præterea dum ex puncto A primum emergeret, ac deinde ar­
cum HS, decurreret, qui continet Diametrum 1 1/5. ac denuo immergere­
tur in puncto S, ac proinde tunc di&longs;taret à centro Iovis, Diametr. 1 1/5. dato
quod AK e&longs;&longs;et 11. Diametror.

at &longs;ecus accidit ob&longs;ervanti; illud enim &longs;e­
cundæ immer&longs;ionis punctum à centro Iovis minùs di&longs;tabat.

Ob&longs;ervatio ce­
lebris fuit Die 23. Septembr. hujus Anni 1664. Hor.po&longs;t Merid.6. min.46.
circiter: vbi enim a&longs;pexi quartam Mediceam ex vmbra primùm emergen­
tem, illa haud dubiè à Iovis centro vix di&longs;tabat Diametr. 1 1/2. tum au­
tem aderant, præter Eu&longs;tachium no&longs;trum, duo viri præ&longs;tanti&longs;&longs;imi, & rerum
i&longs;tarum periti&longs;&longs;imi, &longs;cilicet D.
Ciampinus & D. Lucius.

Octavò, Hinc autem axem parabolæ, quam Epicycli loco &longs;ub&longs;titui po&longs;­
&longs;e, jam &longs;upra &longs;ignificavi, habere po&longs;&longs;um; a&longs;&longs;umpta enim AC Diametr. 1 1/2.
& ducta CT parallela AG, &longs;it vt AE ad AC, ita hæc ad tertiam, &longs;itque
vt differentia hujus tertiæ & AE, ad CT, ita AE ad AX, hæc e&longs;t axis
Parabolæ; e&longs;t autem AC ad CT, vt BD ad DL. pro aliis Mediceis, ea­
dem ratio facit.

Nonò, Scio, e&longs;&longs;e nonnullos, qui excentricos adhibent, quorum centrum
&longs;it versùs ortum, vel occa&longs;um; &longs;ed profectò maxima digre&longs;&longs;io æqualis vtrim­
que &longs;emper à me ob&longs;ervata e&longs;t, eju&longs;dem &longs;cilicet Mediceæ.

Decimò, Quod &longs;pectat ad latitudinem Medicearum, certò con&longs;tat, ex
ob&longs;ervationibus, eas non videri &longs;emper in eadem linea, per centrum Iovis
ducta, id e&longs;t, in eodem plano Iovialis orbitæ; vnde aliqui epicyclos adhi­
bent, à prædictæ orbitæ plano declinantes; &longs;ed, ni fallor, perperam; cum
&longs;æpè accidat, eandem Mediceam in eadem à centro Iovis di&longs;tantia, &longs;ive ad
ortum, &longs;ive ad occa&longs;um, modò versùs Boream, modò versùs Au&longs;trum decli­
nare, modò in linea, per centrum Iovis ducta, ab&longs;que vlla declinatione, &longs;i­
tam e&longs;&longs;e: hoc autem ex eo procedit, quod Medicea ni&longs;um exerat, adhoc vt
&longs;emper in eo plano ver&longs;etur, ac proinde ratione motus accelerati & retar­
dati, lineam &longs;uperet, & modò huc, modò illuc declinet: &longs;ed hujus declina­
tionis limes nondum per&longs;pectus e&longs;t, nec periodus comperta; quare accu­
ratiori opus e&longs;t indagine.

Vndecimò, Medicea non movetur in Epicyclo, reali motu, quod facilè
demon&longs;tratur; &longs;it enim quarta Medicea in Apogæo G.movetur versùs or­
tum, & diurno motu acquirit in linea AE Diametros Iovis 2 1/2.id e&longs;t min.2.
&longs;ec.4ò.

Iupiter verò &longs;ingulis annis, ortum versùs acquirit 30.grad.circiter
&longs;ingulis men&longs;ibus grad. 2. 3ò, &longs;ingulis diebus min. 5. igitur Medicea
primo die recederet à Iovis centro min. 2. 2ò, versùs occa&longs;um: de­
fertur, inquies, à Iove centrum Epicycli; &longs;ed profectò deferri nequit, ni&longs;i
&longs;olidum &longs;upponas: annulum fortè &longs;olidum accer&longs;es, cui Medicea affixa &longs;it,
vt in Saturno; fateor, hoc dici po&longs;&longs;e, modò dictus annulus nihil pror&longs;us lu­
minis reflectat; ob&longs;tat tamen allata &longs;upra &longs;patiorum æqualium motu diur­
no acqui&longs;itorum ratio, ni&longs;i parabolam ponas.

Sed longè facilius dictu e&longs;t,
Iovem & Mediceam æquali motu moveri, eoque &longs;implici&longs;&longs;imo, occa&longs;um
versùs; ac proinde illam versùs occa&longs;um ire apparenter, à puncto maximæ
digre&longs;&longs;ionis ortivæ, ad punctum maximæ occiduæ; & ab hac, ad illam, ver-
sùs ortum; quia majorem orbem de&longs;cribit ab occidua ad ortivam, mino­
rem verò, ab ortiva ad occiduam.

Duodecimò, Locorum longitudo facilè haberi pote&longs;t ex immer&longs;ione, vel
emer&longs;ione Medicearum, &longs;i à duobus, vel pluribus, eadem nocte, in diver&longs;is
locis ob&longs;erventur; idque faciliùs, quàm ex Lunari, aut Solari deliquio: tum
quia hæc deliquia rariùs accidunt; tum quia minùs timendum e&longs;t à Para­
laxi, propter altitudinem, tum demum quia, cum ferè ad in&longs;tar puncti ap­
pareant, nullam temporis moram ob&longs;ervatio de&longs;iderat.

Hæc &longs;unt vir præ­
&longs;tanti&longs;&longs;imè, quæ addenda e&longs;&longs;e judicavi.
